headline: Bite-Sized Salmon Tikka
name: Bite-Sized Salmon Tikka
description: Salmon is versatile, highly nutritious, and can be bought fresh or frozen. This 'Indianised' recipe is quick, tasty, and ideal as a short snack or a meal eaten with a salad.
recipeIngredient: 0.5 pound wild Pacific salmon fillets, cut into 1-inch cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the cayenne, turmeric, and salt in a bowl. Add the salmon to the bowl and toss to coat. Allow to sit 15 minutes.
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. While the oil is heating, sprinkle the cornstarch over the salmon and again toss to coat.
Cook the salmon in the heated oil until golden brown, about 1 minute per side.
